sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Oppenheimer Keeps Their Buy Rating on Amprius Technologies Inc (AMPX)
feed.summary: Oppenheimer analyst Colin Rusch has maintained a Buy rating on Amprius Technologies Inc (AMPX) with a price target of $17.00. The company reported quarterly revenue of $21.43 million and a GAAP net loss of $3.89 million for the quarter ending September 30, showing significant improvement year-over-year. Despite a strong buy consensus among analysts, corporate insider sentiment for AMPX is currently negative, with several insiders selling shares recently.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) Stock Price Down 3.9% - Should You Sell?
feed.summary: Shares of Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) fell 3.9% during mid-day trading to $8.72 on Tuesday, trading below its 50-day moving average. Despite this dip, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a consensus target price of $14.57. However, company insiders, including the CEO and CTO, have been net sellers in the last quarter, offloading over 1.29 million shares.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) Shares Gap Down - Should You Sell?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) gapped down after closing at $9.07, opening at $8.79 and last trading around $8.74, despite a "Moderate Buy" consensus from analysts with an average target price of $14.57. The company beat revenue and EPS estimates but remains unprofitable, and insiders have recently sold roughly 1.29 million shares. Institutional investors have increased their stakes, with Vanguard Group Inc. boosting its holdings by 37%.

feed.title: Is It Too Late to Chase Amprius Technologies After Its 377% Surge in 2025?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) has seen a dramatic 377.4% surge over the last year, raising questions about its current valuation despite recent pullbacks. Simply Wall St's analysis suggests the stock may be overvalued by both Discounted Cash Flow and Price-to-Sales metrics, scoring only 2 out of 6 on valuation checks. The article encourages investors to use "Narratives" on their platform to form their own financial forecasts and fair value assessments based on potential bullish or cautious scenarios for the company.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies announces CEO transition and executive compensation changes
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) announced that CEO Dr. Kang Sun will transition to Executive Advisor and remain on the board, effective December 31, 2025. Tom Stepien, current President, will succeed him as CEO starting January 1, 2026. The company detailed executive compensation for both Dr. Sun and Mr. Stepien, including salaries, bonus eligibility, and equity awards.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) shifts CEO role to Tom Stepien as Kang Sun becomes advisor
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies announced a leadership transition where CEO Dr. Kang Sun will step down effective December 31, 2025, to become an Executive Advisor, while remaining on the board. Tom Stepien, the current President, will assume the CEO role starting January 1, 2026. The company stated that Dr. Sun's departure is not due to any disagreements regarding operations or policies.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies Announces CEO Transition
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies has announced that its President, Tom Stepien, will become the new CEO effective January 1, 2026. Current CEO Dr. Kang Sun will retire at the end of 2025 but will remain on the Board of Directors and serve as an Executive Advisor. Stepien, who joined Amprius in May 2025, brings extensive leadership experience in technology and energy storage to lead the company's next phase of growth.

feed.title: CA-AMPRIUS-TECHNOLOGIES
feed.summary: Amprius President Tom Stepien has been appointed chief executive officer by the Board of Directors, with the change effective January 1, 2026. This announcement was made via Business Wire.

feed.title: Peering Into Amprius Technologies Inc's Recent Short Interest
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies Inc (NYSE: AMPX) has seen a 15.92% decrease in its short interest since the last report, with 13.51 million shares sold short, representing 11.41% of its float. This decline in short interest could indicate a more bullish sentiment among investors. Compared to its peers, Amprius Technologies Inc has less short interest, with its peer group average standing at 12.88%.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) Shares Down 14.4% - Time to Sell?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) shares dropped 14.4% on Wednesday, with significant trading volume, closing at $8.7950. Analysts have a mixed-to-positive outlook, with an average "Moderate Buy" rating and a target price of $14.29, despite the company remaining unprofitable and recent insider stock sales. Institutional investors have been increasing their stakes, indicating continued interest.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies Sees Stock Volatility Amid Industry Buzz
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies Inc. (NYSE: AMPX) is experiencing significant stock volatility, with shares trading down by -9.73% due to investor sentiment concerns and recent financial results showing a net loss despite substantial cash-on-hand. Despite challenges like decreasing EBIT margins and rising raw material costs, the company has strong short-term liquidity. The article emphasizes that prudent evaluation, strategic execution, and balancing innovation with financial pragmatism will be crucial for Amprius's future, as traders weigh potential buying opportunities against caution.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) Stock Price Up 2% - Still a Buy?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (NYSE: AMPX) saw its stock price rise by 2% on Tuesday, trading at $10.25 with reduced volume. Despite beating recent earnings estimates, the company remains unprofitable with negative net margins. Significant insider selling, including by the CEO, has occurred recently, though analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target price of $14.29.

feed.title: Amprius Expands Korea Battery Alliance with NDAA-Compliant Manufacturing Network
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (NYSE: AMPX) has expanded its Korea Battery Alliance by adding three new contract manufacturers, significantly boosting its global production capacity to over 2 GWh for its SiCore® battery technology. This expansion strengthens NDAA-compliant supply chains crucial for defense and aerospace applications and reinforces South Korea's role as a hub for advanced battery technology. The initiative aims to accelerate the production of Amprius' high-energy density silicon anode batteries within a secure framework.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) Shares Down 7.9% - What's Next?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) shares fell 7.9% during intraday trading, closing at $10.0450 with heavy trading volume. Despite the dip, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target price of $14.29, suggesting potential upside. The company recently beat EPS and revenue estimates but remains unprofitable, and insiders have been net sellers of the stock.

feed.title: Amprius Expands Korea Battery Alliance with Three New Contract Manufacturers
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies announced the expansion of its Korea Battery Alliance, adding three new contract manufacturers. This expansion aims to broaden Amprius’s global manufacturing network and align with the requirements of the U.S. National Defense Authorization Act, strengthening its supply chain within allied nations. The partnerships will help meet the increasing demand for Amprius’s high-energy-density batteries and accelerate the production of its SiCore® products.

feed.title: Amprius Expands Korea Battery Alliance with Three New Contract Manufacturers
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies, Inc. announced the expansion of its Amprius Korea Battery Alliance with three new contract manufacturers, strengthening its NDAA-compliant global manufacturing network. This move provides direct access to Korea's advanced battery production ecosystem, supporting Amprius' expansion into trusted allied nations and increasing its contract manufacturing network to over 2 GWh of global capacity. The expansion aims to scale SiCore® production and meet growing demand across key markets, reinforcing Daejeon's position as an innovation hub.

feed.title: Assessing Amprius Technologies (AMPX) Valuation After Nokia Selects Its SiCore Batteries for Next‑Gen Drones
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) recently secured a significant validation with Nokia selecting its SiCore batteries for next-generation drones, despite a short-term dip in share price, following a strong year-to-date performance. The article presents two valuation models: a "Narrative" model suggesting the stock is 36.4% undervalued with a fair value of $17.17, and a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) model indicating it might be overvalued at $7.76. Investors are left to decide whether the market fully accounts for Amprius's future growth potential.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:AMPX) Receives Average Rating of "Moderate Buy" from Analysts
feed.summary: Nine analysts have given Amprius Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:AMPX) an average rating of "Moderate Buy," with eight "buy" recommendations and one "sell." The average one-year price target is $14.29, despite recent insider selling by the CEO and CTO. The company reported a beat on revenue and EPS estimates but remains unprofitable.

($AMPX) by nearly doubling its holdings with the purchase of 500,212 shares in the second quarter. The institutional investor now owns over a million shares, valued at approximately $4.21 million. Despite this institutional accumulation, insider selling by the CEO and CTO has been noted, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a consensus price target of $14.29.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) Trading Down 5.6% - Should You Sell?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) saw its share price drop by 5.6% to $11.045, with trading volume up 4% from its daily average. Despite analysts giving it a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target of $14.29 and the company beating quarterly estimates, Amprius remains unprofitable with negative margins. Insider selling over the past 90 days totaled over 1.09 million shares, worth approximately $11.5 million.

feed.title: Geode Capital Management LLC Increases Stock Holdings in Amprius Technologies, Inc. $AMPX
feed.summary: Geode Capital Management LLC significantly increased its stake in Amprius Technologies (NYSE:AMPX) by 167.9% in Q2, acquiring 1,593,607 shares valued at $6.71 million. This increase occurred despite recent insider share sales by the CTO and CEO, totaling over $1.1 million, and the company has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average target price of $14.29. Amprius also reported strong Q3 earnings, beating EPS and revenue estimates.

feed.title: A look at Amprius Technologies’ valuation after Nokia selects its batteries for next‑gen drone networks
feed.summary: Nokia's selection of Amprius Technologies (AMPX) SiCore cells for its next-generation drone networks has highlighted the battery maker's technology, coinciding with significant momentum in Amprius's share price, which has seen nearly a 500% return in a year. While one narrative suggests the company is 29% undervalued with a fair value of $17.17 based on aggressive growth and margin expansion assumptions, another valuation lens focusing on the price-to-sales ratio indicates the market is already paying heavily for future growth, with a P/S of 27.2x compared to an industry average of 2.2x. This suggests less margin for error if execution falters, despite the optimistic analyst targets.

feed.title: Amprius Sets December 2025 Events Schedule
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies, Inc. announced its schedule for December 2025 appearances, including participation in the B. Riley Convergence Conference, the 25th Annual Advanced Automotive Battery Conference (AABC), and the Northland Growth Conference. Company executives will meet with investors and present on breakthrough silicon anode technology.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:AMPX): When Will It Breakeven?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies, Inc. is a US$1.4 billion market-cap company focused on developing, manufacturing, and marketing lithium-ion batteries. Analysts predict the company will breakeven in 2027, turning a profit of US$7.8 million after a final loss in 2026. This projection relies on an optimistic annual growth rate of 66%.

feed.title: Nokia Drone Networks Integrates Amprius SiCore® Batteries to Advance High-Reliability Operations
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies' SiCore® batteries have been selected by Nokia for its next-generation drone systems, based on their endurance, power delivery, and safety performance. This integration will enhance the capabilities of Nokia Drone Networks, allowing for extended mission range, increased payload versatility, and improved system efficiency for industrial inspection, public safety, and emergency response. The partnership strengthens both companies' positions in advancing high-impact aerial operations and electrified mobility.

feed.title: Should Amprius Technologies’ (AMPX) Record US$35 Million Reorder and Q3 Beat Prompt Investor Action?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) recently reported strong Q3 2025 earnings, surpassing analyst expectations with a smaller loss and higher revenue, alongside securing its largest-ever customer reorder worth US$35 million. These developments indicate growing commercial interest in Amprius's SiCore battery technology, particularly for advanced aviation and drone markets. However, the company faces concentration risk as over 90% of its revenue still comes from a few high-value contracts, making customer diversification a critical short-term goal despite its new partnerships like the Amprius Korea Battery Alliance.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) Establishes Amprius Korea Battery Alliance, Here’s What You Need To Know
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) has formed the Amprius Korea Battery Alliance to enhance global partnerships, diversify its manufacturing, and collaborate with supply chain partners. This initiative follows a significant 172.77% year-over-year revenue growth in Q3 2025, driven by increased SiCore battery shipments. Analysts have responded positively, with B. Riley Securities raising its price target for AMPX from $11 to $16.

feed.title: Amprius Launches Korea Battery Alliance to Advance Global Energy Supply Chain
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies has established the Amprius Korea Battery Alliance to enhance its international presence and expedite the commercialization of advanced silicon anode battery technologies. This alliance connects Amprius with key Korean companies across the lithium-ion battery supply chain, fostering collaboration on technical and commercial projects. The initiative builds on Amprius' existing global operations, aiming to strengthen the energy supply chain for electric mobility and clean energy solutions worldwide.

feed.title: This Silicon Valley startup is heading to China to make its batteries
feed.summary: Amprius, a Silicon Valley startup backed by Eric Schmidt, is partnering with the Chinese city of Wuxi to build a large factory for its innovative silicon-based lithium-ion batteries. This move highlights China's bullish stance on electric vehicles and domestic industry development, and the difficulty for U.S. energy startups to secure sufficient funding for manufacturing domestically. The company aims to mass produce batteries that last significantly longer, potentially expanding into the electric vehicle market.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies Boosts Influences with Strategic Moves in UAV and Leadership
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) stock surged 15.7% following strategic moves including ESAero's selection of its SA08 silicon-anode battery cell for UAVs, increased production capacity to 1.8 GWh, and the appointment of Ricardo C. Rodriguez as CFO. Analyst targets from Roth Capital ($14) and Northland ($20) reflect optimism despite current negative profitability ratios and high expenditure. The company shows strong revenue growth and a robust financial structure, positioning it for future opportunities in aerospace and electric aviation.

feed.title: Amprius Sets September 2025 Events Schedule
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies, Inc. announced its schedule for September 2025 appearances and activities, including participation in major industry events like the Commercial Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (CUAV) Expo, Gateway Conference, H.C. Wainwright Global Investment Conference, Defense and Security Exhibition International (DSEI), and DroneX. Key executives, including CEO Dr. Kang Sun and CFO Sandra Wallach, will be present at various events for meetings and presentations with investors and business development teams. The company, a leader in next-generation lithium-ion batteries, will also exhibit its SiCore® and SiMaxx™ batteries at several shows.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies Gains Market Confidence with Strategic Developments and New CFO
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies' stock has risen by 15.7% due to increased investor confidence, driven by strategic developments like its SA08 battery cell selection by ESAero for UAVs and the appointment of Ricardo C. Rodriguez as CFO. Despite weak profitability indicators and high valuation concerns, the company exhibits strong financial strength and a bullish stock trend. Analysts have raised price targets, reflecting optimism about Amprius's market-leading technology and growth potential in the defense and public safety sectors.

feed.title: Will Amprius Technologies Overcome Challenges?
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies Inc. is experiencing a stock surge driven by advancements in its battery technology and strategic management changes, including the appointment of a new CFO and a partnership with ESAero. Despite past negative profitability margins, analyst upgrades and an impressive revenue surge over the last three years suggest strong potential, although the company faces challenges in stabilizing its profit cycle. The article discusses Amprius' market trajectory, financial performance, and strategic moves aimed at long-term profitability within the rapidly expanding electric aviation sector.

feed.title: Huntleigh Advisors Inc. Buys Shares of 145,914 Amprius Technologies, Inc. $AMPX - MarketBeat
feed.summary: Huntleigh Advisors Inc. significantly increased its stake in Amprius Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:AMPX) by purchasing 145,914 shares valued at approximately $614,000 during the second quarter, now holding a 0.12% ownership. This move aligns with increased institutional investment in Amprius, as other firms like Vanguard and Kingswood Wealth Advisors also boosted their positions. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Amprius Technologies, with an average price target of $13.14, following multiple upgrades.

feed.title: Amprius’ High-Power Silicon Batteries Selected by ESAero to Power Next-Generation UAVs - CleanTechnica
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies' SiCore® SA08 silicon batteries have been selected by ESAero to power its next-generation Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs). This collaboration aims to significantly increase flight times and payload capacity for UAV platforms used in defense, security, logistics, and public safety applications. Both companies emphasize the advanced battery technology, production readiness, and cost-effectiveness of Amprius' silicon anode cells in meeting demanding performance requirements.

feed.title: Northland Doubles Amprius Technologies (AMPX) PT to $20 Following New CFO Appointment - Insider Monkey
feed.summary: Northland has doubled its price target for Amprius Technologies (AMPX) to $20 from $10, maintaining an Outperform rating, following the appointment of a new CFO, Ricardo Rodriguez. The firm anticipates substantial growth for Amprius, driven by an expected sequential revenue increase in Q3 2025 as more customers transition from qualification to production orders. This positive outlook is supported by Amprius's strong Q2 2025 sales and achievement of positive gross margins.

feed.title: Northland Doubles Amprius Technologies (AMPX) PT to $20 Following New CFO Appointment - Insider Monkey
feed.summary: Northland has doubled its price target for Amprius Technologies (AMPX) to $20 from $10, maintaining an Outperform rating, following the appointment of Ricardo Rodriguez as the new CFO. This upgrade reflects Northland's comfort with Amprius' financial forecasts and the expectation of significant revenue growth in Q3 2025, driven by existing customers transitioning to production orders. Amprius reported strong Q2 sales of $15.1 million, a 34% sequential increase, and achieved positive gross margins for the first time thanks to its Cyorp product and expanding customer base.

feed.title: Northland Doubles Amprius Technologies (AMPX) PT to $20 Following New CFO Appointment - Yahoo
feed.summary: Northland has increased its price target for Amprius Technologies (AMPX) to $20, maintaining comfort with the company's financial forecasts. Amprius reported a 34% sequential and 350% year-over-year increase in Q2 sales, achieving positive gross margins for the first time thanks to its Cyorp product and expanded customer base. The company expects continued revenue growth in Q3 as more customers transition to production orders.

feed.title: Amprius (AMPX) Surges 10.3%: Is This an Indication of Further Gains? - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) surged 10.3% recently, driven by a 450% year-over-year increase in SiCore shipments in Q2 2025. While the company anticipates a quarterly loss of $0.06 per share on $17.07 million in revenue, its Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) suggests monitoring future earnings estimate revisions for sustained gains.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies Hits 3-Year Highs On ESAero UAV Battery Deal - Stocktwits
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies (AMPX) shares reached a three-year high of $16.03 after Empirical Systems Aerospace (ESAero) selected its Amprius SiCore SA08 cell for integration into battery packs for unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs). This partnership is expected to significantly increase flight times and payload capacity for UAVs in defense, security, logistics, and public safety applications. Shares rose over 18% in early trading, and retail sentiment improved to 'neutral.'

feed.title: Amprius' High-Power Silicon Batteries Selected by ESAero to Powe - GuruFocus
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies' SiCore® SA08 cell has been chosen by Empirical Systems Aerospace, Inc. (ESAero) to power its next-generation Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs). This selection is due to the battery's ability to significantly extend flight times and increase payload capacity for UAVs used in defense, security, logistics, and public safety. The collaboration highlights Amprius' growing presence in the UAV sector and their ability to deliver high-performance silicon anode cells at scale.

feed.title: ESAero selects Amprius silicon anode batteries for UAV power By Investing.com - Investing.com Australia
feed.summary: The article reports that ESAero has chosen Amprius silicon anode batteries to power its Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs). This selection highlights a potential advancement in UAV technology through improved battery performance. However, there is an application error preventing the full article content from loading.

feed.title: Amprius’ High-Power Silicon Batteries Selected by ESAero to Power Next-Generation UAVs - bastillepost.com
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies, a leader in silicon anode lithium-ion batteries, announced that Empirical Systems Aerospace, Inc. (ESAero) has selected its SiCore® SA08 cell to power next-generation Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs). This collaboration aims to significantly increase UAV flight times and payload capacity for defense, security, logistics, and public safety applications. ESAero CEO Andrew Gibson highlighted Amprius's advanced battery technology, production readiness, and cost competitiveness as key factors in their decision, enabling industry-leading UAV endurance.

feed.title: Lithium Stocks To Watch Today – October 12th - Defense World
feed.summary: This article highlights five lithium stocks to watch: QuantumScape (QS), Critical Metals (CRML), Lithium Americas (LAC), American Battery Technology (ABAT), and Amprius Technologies (AMPX). These companies are involved in various aspects of the lithium supply chain, from exploration and mining to battery development and recycling. Investors are looking at these stocks to gain exposure to the growing demand for lithium in electric vehicles and energy storage.

feed.title: Lithium Stocks To Watch Today - October 12th
feed.summary: MarketBeat identifies five lithium stocks with significant recent trading volumes: QuantumScape (QS), Critical Metals (CRML), Lithium Americas (LAC), American Battery Technology (ABAT), and Amprius Technologies (AMPX). The article provides a brief overview of each company, highlighting their focus within the lithium and battery technology sectors, such as QuantumScape's solid-state lithium-metal batteries for EVs and Amprius Technologies' high-density lithium-ion batteries for aviation. These companies represent various facets of the growing demand for lithium in electric vehicles and energy storage.

feed.title: Amprius Technologies, Inc.'s (NYSE:AMPX) 89% Jump Shows Its Popularity With Investors
feed.summary: Amprius Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:AMPX) has seen a significant 89% jump in its share price over the last thirty days, contributing to a 911% gain over the past year. This strong performance has led to a high price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 37.5x, significantly above the industry average. Analysts forecast approximately 90% annual revenue growth for Amprius over the next three years, which justifies its high P/S ratio given expectations of continued strong performance.
